Module org.example.miniproyecto_3
Package org.example.miniproyecto_3.Model

Class Board

java.lang.Object
org.example.miniproyecto_3.Model.Board
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Board extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a game board in Battleship.

The board consists of a 10x10 grid of Cell objects, where ships can be placed and attacks can be made. It handles all logic related to ship placement, attacks, and the state of the game board.

See Also:

    • canShoot

      public boolean canShoot(Coordinate coor)
      Checks whether the given cell can be targeted by a shot.
      Parameters:
      coor - the coordinate to check
      Returns:
      true if the cell is shootable, false otherwise

    • placeShip

      public void placeShip(Ship ship, List<Coordinate> coords)
      Places a ship on the board at the given list of coordinates.

      Each coordinate is assigned to the ship, and the ship is added to the board's ship list.

      Parameters:
      ship - the ship to place
      coords - the list of coordinates where the ship will be placed

    • removeShip

      public void removeShip(Ship ship)
      Removes a ship from the board and clears its associated cells.
      Parameters:
      ship - the ship to remove

    • fireAt

      public Cell.CellState fireAt(Coordinate coor) throws NonShootableCell
      Fires at the specified coordinate and updates the cell's state.
      Parameters:
      coor - the coordinate to fire at
      Returns:
      the resulting state of the cell (HIT, MISS, etc.)
      Throws:
      NonShootableCell - if the cell has already been targeted
      IllegalArgumentException - if the coordinate is out of bounds

    • canPlaceShip

      public boolean canPlaceShip(int size, Coordinate headCoord, IShip.Orientation orientation)
      Checks if a ship of the given size can be placed starting from the head coordinate in the specified orientation without overlapping existing ships.
      Parameters:
      size - the size of the ship
      headCoord - the starting coordinate of the ship
      orientation - the orientation of the ship (HORIZONTAL or VERTICAL)
      Returns:
      true if the ship can be placed, false otherwise
